page.title: 07FENSTANTON POST OFFICE
page.content: The{Post Office}has been in the {High Street Fenstanton}for at least 50 years. Before that it was where the { {village pond}is now. The{Hobbs family have run the {Post Office}for about { {50}years.For{20}years Mr.Hobbs'father ran the Post Office from his house. Where the{double garage doors}are there was a{Fish Shop.}It had an open roof where birds would nest.It sold { fresh fish and fish and chips.This was cooked in a large cast iron pan with long handles,over an {open fire}. Next to the{Post Office}now stands our{fish and chip shop}but,in the days of Mr.Hobbs'father there was a piece of open land used as a{cattle pound.} If a cow strayed from a field and was found by the{local bobby}or{farmer}it was taken to the{pound}where the owners could collect it for a fee.
